info.name: The Odds API
info.description: To access the API, get a free API key from https://the-odds-api.com

item.name: Returns list of live and upcoming events for a given sport, showing bookmaker odds for the specified region and markets

query.description: (Required) Access key (40 characters). Get an API key at https://the-odds-api.com/#get-access

(Required) Determines which bookmakers appear in the response. Multiple regions can be specified if comma delimited. Each region will count as 1 request against the usage quota for each market. Most use cases will only need to specify one region. For a list of bookmakers by region, see https://the-odds-api.com/sports-odds-data/bookmaker-apis.html
The odds market to return. Multiple markets can be specified if comma delimited. Defaults to h2h (head to head / moneyline). Outrights are only avaialable for select sports, such as golf.
Format of returned timestamps. Can be iso (ISO8601) or unix timestamp (seconds since epoch)
Format of returned odds
Comma-separated event ids. Filters the response to only return events for the specified ids, provided those events have not expired

Comma-separated list of bookmakers to be returned. If both `bookmakers` and `regions` are specified, `bookmakers` takes precendence. Bookmakers can be from any region. Every group of 10 bookmakers counts as 1 request. For example for a single market, specifying up to 10 bookmakers is the equivalent of 1 region. Specifying between 11 and 20 bookmakers is the equivalent of 2 regions
Filters the response to show events that commence on and after this parameter. Values are in ISO8601 format
Filters the response to show events that commence on and before this parameter. Values are in ISO8601 format
The response will include bookmaker links to events, markets, and betslips if available.
The response will include source ids (bookmaker ids) for events, markets, and outcomes if available.
The response will include the bet limit of each betting option, mainly available for betting exchanges.

variable.description: (Required) sport key for which to return events and odds. This is obtained from the /sports endpoint

request.description: Returns list of live and upcoming events for a given sport, showing bookmaker odds for the specified region and markets

response.name: A list of live and upcoming events for the specified sport, including odds from bookmakers in the specific region for the specified market

query.description: (Required) Access key (40 characters). Get an API key at https://the-odds-api.com/#get-access

(Required) Determines which bookmakers appear in the response. Multiple regions can be specified if comma delimited. Each region will count as 1 request against the usage quota for each market. Most use cases will only need to specify one region. For a list of bookmakers by region, see https://the-odds-api.com/sports-odds-data/bookmaker-apis.html
The odds market to return. Multiple markets can be specified if comma delimited. Defaults to h2h (head to head / moneyline). Outrights are only avaialable for select sports, such as golf.
Format of returned timestamps. Can be iso (ISO8601) or unix timestamp (seconds since epoch)
Format of returned odds
Comma-separated event ids. Filters the response to only return events for the specified ids, provided those events have not expired

Comma-separated list of bookmakers to be returned. If both `bookmakers` and `regions` are specified, `bookmakers` takes precendence. Bookmakers can be from any region. Every group of 10 bookmakers counts as 1 request. For example for a single market, specifying up to 10 bookmakers is the equivalent of 1 region. Specifying between 11 and 20 bookmakers is the equivalent of 2 regions
Filters the response to show events that commence on and after this parameter. Values are in ISO8601 format
Filters the response to show events that commence on and before this parameter. Values are in ISO8601 format
The response will include bookmaker links to events, markets, and betslips if available.
The response will include source ids (bookmaker ids) for events, markets, and outcomes if available.
The response will include the bet limit of each betting option, mainly available for betting exchanges.

description.content: The number of requests remaining until the quota resets
The number of requests used since the last quota reset
The usage cost of the last API call

response.name: Unauthenticated or unauthorized. The API key might be missing or invalid (unauthenticated), or it might at its usage limit (unauthorized). The repsonse body will contain more info

item.name: Returns list of live and upcoming events for a given sport, and optionally recently completed events. Live and completed events will contain scores

query.description: (Required) Access key (40 characters). Get an API key at https://the-odds-api.com/#get-access
The number of days in the past from which to return completed events. Valid values are integers from `1` to `3`. If this field is missing, only live and upcoming events are returned.
Format of returned timestamps. Can be iso (ISO8601) or unix timestamp (seconds since epoch)
Comma-separated event ids. Filters the response to only return events for the specified ids, provided those events have not expired

variable.description: (Required) sport key for which to return events and odds

request.description: Returns list of live and upcoming events for a given sport, and optionally recently completed events. Live and completed events will contain scores

response.name: A list of live and upcoming events for the specified sport, and optionally recently completed events. Scores will be included for live and recently completed events.

query.description: (Required) Access key (40 characters). Get an API key at https://the-odds-api.com/#get-access
The number of days in the past from which to return completed events. Valid values are integers from `1` to `3`. If this field is missing, only live and upcoming events are returned.
Format of returned timestamps. Can be iso (ISO8601) or unix timestamp (seconds since epoch)
Comma-separated event ids. Filters the response to only return events for the specified ids, provided those events have not expired

description.content: The number of requests remaining until the quota resets
The number of requests used since the last quota reset
The usage cost of the last API call

item.name: Returns bookmaker odds for a single event as long as the event is still valid (live or upcoming). Accepts any available market keys using the `markets` parameter. Use this endpoint to access any available markets for an event. For the most popular feature

query.description: (Required) Access key (40 characters). Get an API key at https://the-odds-api.com/#get-access

(Required) Determines which bookmakers appear in the response. Multiple regions can be specified if comma delimited. Each region will count as 1 request against the usage quota for each market. Most use cases will only need to specify one region. See [the full list of bookmakers by region](https://the-odds-api.com/sports-odds-data/bookmaker-apis.html)

The odds markets to return. Multiple markets can be specified if comma delimited. Defaults to h2h (head to head / moneyline). Outrights only avaialable for select sports. See [the full list of supported market keys](https://the-odds-api.com/sports-odds-data/betting-markets.html)
Format of returned timestamps. Can be iso (ISO8601) or unix timestamp (seconds since epoch)
Format of returned odds

Comma-separated list of bookmakers to be returned. If both `bookmakers` and `regions` are specified, `bookmakers` takes precendence. Bookmakers can be from any region. Every group of 10 bookmakers counts as 1 request. For example for a single market, specifying up to 10 bookmakers counts as 1 request. Specifying between 11 and 20 bookmakers counts as 2 requests
The response will include bookmaker links to events, markets, and betslips if available.
The response will include source ids (bookmaker ids) for events, markets, and outcomes if available.
The response will include the bet limit of each betting option, mainly available for betting exchanges.

variable.description: (Required) sport key for which to return events and odds. This is obtained from the /sports endpoint

(Required) Event ids can be found in the `id` field in the response of the `/events` endpoint (see `/v4/sports/{sports}/events`). If the event has expired (not receiving updates due to completion or cancellation), a HTTP 404 status code will be returned.

request.description: Returns bookmaker odds for a single event as long as the event is still valid (live or upcoming). Accepts any available market keys using the `markets` parameter. Use this endpoint to access any available markets for an event. For the most popular featured markets, use the `/v4/sports/{sport}/odds` endpoint (see above). The API is gradually expanding coverage to more betting markets. [See the full list here](https://the-odds-api.com/sports-odds-data/betting-markets.html)

response.name: The event with the eventId specified in the path parameter. Includes odds from bookmakers in the specified region for the specified markets

query.description: (Required) Access key (40 characters). Get an API key at https://the-odds-api.com/#get-access

(Required) Determines which bookmakers appear in the response. Multiple regions can be specified if comma delimited. Each region will count as 1 request against the usage quota for each market. Most use cases will only need to specify one region. See [the full list of bookmakers by region](https://the-odds-api.com/sports-odds-data/bookmaker-apis.html)

The odds markets to return. Multiple markets can be specified if comma delimited. Defaults to h2h (head to head / moneyline). Outrights only avaialable for select sports. See [the full list of supported market keys](https://the-odds-api.com/sports-odds-data/betting-markets.html)
Format of returned timestamps. Can be iso (ISO8601) or unix timestamp (seconds since epoch)
Format of returned odds

Comma-separated list of bookmakers to be returned. If both `bookmakers` and `regions` are specified, `bookmakers` takes precendence. Bookmakers can be from any region. Every group of 10 bookmakers counts as 1 request. For example for a single market, specifying up to 10 bookmakers counts as 1 request. Specifying between 11 and 20 bookmakers counts as 2 requests
The response will include bookmaker links to events, markets, and betslips if available.
The response will include source ids (bookmaker ids) for events, markets, and outcomes if available.
The response will include the bet limit of each betting option, mainly available for betting exchanges.

description.content: The number of requests remaining until the quota resets
The number of requests used since the last quota reset
The usage cost of the last API call

response.name: Unauthenticated or unauthorized. The API key might be missing or invalid (unauthenticated), or it might at its usage limit (unauthorized). The repsonse body will contain more info

Every group of 10 bookmakers counts as 1 request. For example for a single market, specifying up to 10 bookmakers counts as 1 request. Specifying between 11 and 20 bookmakers counts as 2 requests
The response will include bookmaker links to events, markets, and betslips if available.
The response will include source ids (bookmaker ids) for events, markets, and outcomes if available.
The response will include the bet limit of each betting option, mainly available for betting exchanges.

item.name: A successful response includes a list of available sports and tournaments

query.description: (Required) Get an API key at https://the-odds-api.com/#get-access
When excluded, only recently updated (in-season) sports appear. Include this paramter to see all available sports

request.description: A successful response includes a list of available sports and tournaments

response.name: Returns a list of available sports. Use the sport "key" in the /odds request

query.description: (Required) Get an API key at https://the-odds-api.com/#get-access
When excluded, only recently updated (in-season) sports appear. Include this paramter to see all available sports

item.name: Returns list of live and upcoming events at a point in time for a given sport, including bookmaker odds for the specified region and markets. This endpoint will only return featured markets (moneyline, match winner, 1x2, head-to-head, spreads, totals, ove

query.description: (Required) Access key (40 characters). Get an API key at https://the-odds-api.com/#get-access

(Required) Determines which bookmakers appear in the response. Multiple regions can be specified if comma delimited. Most use cases will only need to specify one region. For a list of bookmakers by region, see https://the-odds-api.com/sports-odds-data/bookmaker-apis.html
The odds market to return. Multiple markets can be specified if comma delimited. Defaults to h2h (head to head / moneyline). Outrights are only avaialable for select sports, such as golf.
Format of returned timestamps. Can be iso (ISO8601) or unix timestamp (seconds since epoch)
Format of returned odds
Comma-separated event ids. Filters the response to only return events for the specified ids, provided those events have not expired

Comma-separated list of bookmakers to be returned. If both `bookmakers` and `regions` are specified, `bookmakers` takes precendence. Bookmakers can be from any region. Every group of 10 bookmakers counts as 1 request. For example for a single market, specifying up to 10 bookmakers counts as 1 request. Specifying between 11 and 20 bookmakers counts as 2 requests

(Required) The timestamp of the data snapshot to be returned, specified in ISO8601 format. The historical odds API will return the closest snapshot equal to or earlier than the provided date parameter

variable.description: (Required) sport key for which to return events and odds. This is obtained from the /sports endpoint

request.description: Returns list of live and upcoming events at a point in time for a given sport, including bookmaker odds for the specified region and markets. This endpoint will only return featured markets (moneyline, match winner, 1x2, head-to-head, spreads, totals, over/under, outrights etc.), using the market keys `h2h`, `spreads`, `totals`. This endpoint was previously `/v4/sports/{sport}/odds-history`, which has been deprecated.

response.name: A list of live and upcoming events and bookmaker odds for the specified sport, from the historical snapshot closest to the specified date

query.description: (Required) Access key (40 characters). Get an API key at https://the-odds-api.com/#get-access

(Required) Determines which bookmakers appear in the response. Multiple regions can be specified if comma delimited. Most use cases will only need to specify one region. For a list of bookmakers by region, see https://the-odds-api.com/sports-odds-data/bookmaker-apis.html
The odds market to return. Multiple markets can be specified if comma delimited. Defaults to h2h (head to head / moneyline). Outrights are only avaialable for select sports, such as golf.
Format of returned timestamps. Can be iso (ISO8601) or unix timestamp (seconds since epoch)
Format of returned odds
Comma-separated event ids. Filters the response to only return events for the specified ids, provided those events have not expired

Comma-separated list of bookmakers to be returned. If both `bookmakers` and `regions` are specified, `bookmakers` takes precendence. Bookmakers can be from any region. Every group of 10 bookmakers counts as 1 request. For example for a single market, specifying up to 10 bookmakers counts as 1 request. Specifying between 11 and 20 bookmakers counts as 2 requests

(Required) The timestamp of the data snapshot to be returned, specified in ISO8601 format. The historical odds API will return the closest snapshot equal to or earlier than the provided date parameter

item.name: Returns bookmaker odds for a single event as they appeared at the specified timestamp (date parameter). Accepts any available market keys using the `markets` parameter. Use this endpoint to access historical odds from any available markets for an event. F

query.description: (Required) Access key (40 characters). Get an API key at https://the-odds-api.com/#get-access

(Required) Determines which bookmakers appear in the response. Multiple regions can be specified if comma delimited. Most use cases will only need to specify one region. See [the full list of bookmakers by region](https://the-odds-api.com/sports-odds-data/bookmaker-apis.html)

The odds markets to return. Multiple markets can be specified if comma delimited. Defaults to h2h (head to head / moneyline). Outrights only avaialable for select sports. See [the full list of supported market keys](https://the-odds-api.com/sports-odds-data/betting-markets.html)
Format of returned timestamps. Can be iso (ISO8601) or unix timestamp (seconds since epoch)
Format of returned odds

Comma-separated list of bookmakers to be returned. If both `bookmakers` and `regions` are specified, `bookmakers` takes precendence. Bookmakers can be from any region. Every group of 10 bookmakers counts as 1 request. For example for a single market, specifying up to 10 bookmakers counts as 1 request. Specifying between 11 and 20 bookmakers counts as 2 requests
(Required) The timestamp of the data snapshot to be returned, specified in ISO8601 format. The API will return the closest snapshot equal to or earlier than the provided date parameter

variable.description: (Required) sport key for which to return events and odds. This is obtained from the /sports endpoint

(Required) Event ids can be found in the `id` field in the response of the historical events endpoint (see `/v4/historical/sports/{sports}/events`). If the event had expired at the specified timestamp (not receiving updates due to completion or cancellation), a HTTP 404 status code will be returned.

request.description: Returns bookmaker odds for a single event as they appeared at the specified timestamp (date parameter). Accepts any available market keys using the `markets` parameter. Use this endpoint to access historical odds from any available markets for an event. For historical odds of the most popular featured markets, use the `/v4/historical/sports/{sport}/odds` endpoint. See the [full list of market keys here](https://the-odds-api.com/sports-odds-data/betting-markets.html)

response.name: The event with the eventId specified in the path parameter. Includes odds from bookmakers in the specified region for the specified markets

query.description: (Required) Access key (40 characters). Get an API key at https://the-odds-api.com/#get-access

The odds markets to return. Multiple markets can be specified if comma delimited. Defaults to h2h (head to head / moneyline). Outrights only avaialable for select sports. See [the full list of supported market keys](https://the-odds-api.com/sports-odds-data/betting-markets.html)
